page.title: 18WITHINGTON WOODS
page.content: The woods are about{1km}south of Withington and about{2km}in size.Most of Withington Wood is owned by Lord Gainsborough. During the{2nd World {War}the{German prisoners}helped to plant the new young trees.In the wood there are 5 different sort of trees and they are called Beech, Oak, Ash, Douglas Fir and Scots Pine.{FAUNA Hare, Rabbit, Fallow Deer,Mole, Fox, Squirrel<grey>,Hedgehog. There are also some badgers and some pheasants are bred. There is{a long barrow;}this is a place where people were buried in the{ {Neolithic Period,}about 4,000 years ago.The body's may not be there any more because people may have dug them up. The long barrow itself is about {50m}long and the hightest end goes upto{2m}high. A long barrow was a chief's grave.{
